Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Probably a noob question, but I will ask anyway. Let's say I do a GET on a
tasks resource which returns a list of tasks. Then I go and do a POST
against the same resource in order to add a new tasks. In the meanwhile
someone else has gone and posted a task to the same resource. Now I need to
determine if the collection I have on the client has changed on the server.

Is the recommended route to save the ETAG when I did the get against the
tasks resource, and after I've posted do a GET again against that collection
using an if match header?

Thanks
Glenn

--00c09f83a2c6e2c5f7048bc2eaf3
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
